section.heading: Certification of program providing low income rental housing.
section.text: For the purposes of qualifying for the depreciation deduction provided by 26 U.S.C. § 167(k)(2)(B) , an investor in a shared equity financing agreement, which qualifies for the benefits provided by the Lower Income Homeownership Tax Abatement and Incentives Act of 1983, and who meets the other requirements of 26 U.S.C. § 167(k)(2)(B) , shall be deemed to have conducted rehabilitation pursuant to a program certified by the District of Columbia government if the investor certifies to the Mayor the amount of the rehabilitation expenditures.

annoGroup.heading: Cross References
annoGroup.annotation: Income and franchise taxes, deductions, depreciation, see § 47-1803.03.

annoGroup.heading: References in Text
annoGroup.annotation: The “Lower Income Homeownership Tax Abatement and Incentives Act of 1983,” referred to in this section, is D.C. Law 5-31.

annoGroup.heading: Delegation of Authority
annoGroup.annotation: Delegation of authority under Law 5-31, see Mayor’s Order 83-270, November 16, 1983.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Mayor authorized to issue rules: Section 9 of D.C. Law 5-31 provided that the Mayor shall issue rules necessary to carry out the provisions of §§ 47-3502 to 47-3507.
